meanings.definition: A person who works for a candidate during an election.
meanings.sent1: During the campaign, the electioneers went door-to-door to promote their candidate.
meanings.sent2: The electioneers handed out flyers and talked to voters at the rally.
meanings.sent3: The electioneers joked about having to wear matching t-shirts every day.
meanings.sent4: The electioneers were like busy bees buzzing around the hive of democracy.
meanings.sent5: The image of the electioneers in their bright shirts stuck in the minds of the voters.

meanings.definition: To work for a candidate during an election.
meanings.sent1: She electioneers for her favorite candidate every election season.
meanings.sent2: They electioneered tirelessly to ensure their candidate's victory.
meanings.sent3: He electioneers with enthusiasm, always eager to spread the word.
meanings.sent4: The volunteers electioneered as if their energy was endless.
meanings.sent5: The team electioneers with passion, making a real difference in the campaign.
